qas.question: What was the reason given for Hayek's 1991 award from the President?

answers.text: a "lifetime of looking beyond the horizon"

qas.question: Which President presented the award to Hayek?
Where was Hayek when he died?
Where was Hayek buried in relation to his home town of Vienna?
Where was The Use of Knowledge in Society published?

context: In 1991, US President <a1_0>George H. W. Bush<a1_0/> awarded Hayek the Presidential Medal of Freedom, one of the two highest civilian awards in the United States, for <a0_0>a "lifetime of looking beyond the horizon"<a0_0/>. Hayek died on 23 March 1992 in <a2_0>Freiburg, Germany<a2_0/>, and was buried on 4 April in the Neustift am Walde cemetery in the <a3_0>northern outskirts<a3_0/> of Vienna according to the Catholic rite. In 2011, his article The Use of Knowledge in Society was selected as one of the top 20 articles published in the <a4_0>American Economic Review<a4_0/> during its first 100 years.
